nvidia-settings is nvidia's proprioetary approach for mode setting and does not really follow linux customs. The the thing like "System Control -> Display -> Properties -> Screen Resolutuion" is a Window-ism and doesn't really make sense for unix.
The wrongness ist that they rewrite xorg.conf each time where only an xrandr-command would be needed
i don't even see anything like "System Control -> Display -> Properties -> Screen Resolutuion" anywhere...
Oh, you can set a modeline with xrandr's --newmode command, then activat that
